com.mlt.desktop.graphic

Class Path

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.mlt.desktop.graphic.Drawing
      • com.mlt.desktop.graphic.Path

  • public class Path
extends Drawing
    A general path.
    Author:
    Miquel Sas

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int WIND_EVEN_ODD
      Winding rule even odd.
      static int WIND_NON_ZERO
      Winding rule non zero.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Path()
      Default constructor, with winding rule non zero and initial capacity of 20.
      Path(int rule, int capacity)
      Constructor with winding rule and initial capacity.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void append(Drawing drawing, boolean connect)
      Appends the geometry of the specified drawing object to the path, possibly connecting the new geometry to the existing path segments with a line segment.
      void closePath()
      Closes the current subpath by drawing a straight line back to the coordinates of the last moveTo.
      void curveTo(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2, double x3, double y3)
      Adds a curved segment, defined by three new points, to the path by drawing a Bézier curve that intersects both the current coordinates and the specified coordinates (x3,y3), using the specified points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) as Bézier control points.
      java.awt.Shape getShape()
      Return this drawing shape.
      void lineTo(double x, double y)
      Adds a point to the path by drawing a straight line.
      void lineTo(Point p)
      Adds a point to the path by drawing a straight line.
      void moveTo(double x, double y)
      Adds a point to the path by moving to the specified coordinates.
      void moveTo(Point p)
      Adds a point to the path by moving to the specified coordinates.
      void quadTo(double x1, double y1, double x2, double y2)
      Adds a curved segment, defined by two new points, to the path by drawing a Quadratic curve that intersects both the current coordinates and the specified coordinates (x2,y2), using the specified point (x1,y1) as a quadratic parametric control point.
      void reset()
      Resets the path to empty.

    • Method Detail

      • append

        public void append(Drawing drawing,
                   boolean connect)
        Appends the geometry of the specified drawing object to the path, possibly connecting the new geometry to the existing path segments with a line segment.
        Parameters:
        drawing - The drawing.
        connect - A boolean.

      • closePath

        public void closePath()
        Closes the current subpath by drawing a straight line back to the coordinates of the last moveTo.

      • curveTo

        public void curveTo(double x1,
                    double y1,
                    double x2,
                    double y2,
                    double x3,
                    double y3)
        Adds a curved segment, defined by three new points, to the path by drawing a Bézier curve that intersects both the current coordinates and the specified coordinates (x3,y3), using the specified points (x1,y1) and (x2,y2) as Bézier control points.
        Parameters:
        x1 - The X coordinate of the first Bézier control point.
        y1 - The Y coordinate of the first Bézier control point.
        x2 - The X coordinate of the second Bézier control point.
        y2 - The Y coordinate of the second Bézier control point.
        x3 - The X coordinate of the third Bézier control point.
        y3 - The Y coordinate of the third Bézier control point.

      • getShape

        public java.awt.Shape getShape()
        Return this drawing shape.
        Specified by:
        getShape in class Drawing
        Returns:
        The shape.

      • lineTo

        public void lineTo(double x,
                   double y)
        Adds a point to the path by drawing a straight line.
        Parameters:
        x - x coord.
        y - y coord.

      • lineTo

        public void lineTo(Point p)
        Adds a point to the path by drawing a straight line.
        Parameters:
        p - The point.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(double x,
                   double y)
        Adds a point to the path by moving to the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - x coord.
        y - y coord.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo(Point p)
        Adds a point to the path by moving to the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        p - The point.

      • quadTo

        public void quadTo(double x1,
                   double y1,
                   double x2,
                   double y2)
        Adds a curved segment, defined by two new points, to the path by drawing a Quadratic curve that intersects both the current coordinates and the specified coordinates (x2,y2), using the specified point (x1,y1) as a quadratic parametric control point.
        Parameters:
        x1 - x coord of the quadratic control point.
        y1 - y coord of the quadratic control point.
        x2 - x coord of the end point.
        y2 - y coord of the end point.

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Resets the path to empty.
